intro: Cuphea urbaniana var. bornmuelleri, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its ornamental value is further enhanced by its long blooming period, which extends from late spring to early autumn.
